sentence.Network_en: Einstein had the chutzpah to discard common sense and long-established theory.
sentence.Network_cn: 爱因斯坦敢于抛弃常识和长期公认的理论。

sentence.Network_en: He is routinely described as the greatest scientist since Einstein.
sentence.Network_cn: 他通常被认为是继爱因斯坦之后最伟大的科学家。

sentence.Network_en: Einstein's equations showed the Universe to be expanding.
sentence.Network_cn: 爱因斯坦的方程式表明宇宙正在膨胀。

encyclopedia.content: 爱因斯坦（1879－1955），美籍德国犹太人。他创立了代表现代科学的相对论，并为核能开发奠定了理论基础，在现代科学技术和他的深刻影响及广泛应用方面开创了现代科学新纪元，被公认为自伽利略、牛顿以来最伟大的科学家、思想家。1921年诺贝尔物理学奖获得者。现代物理学的开创者和奠基人，相对论——“质能关系”的提出者，“决定论量子力学诠释”的捍卫者（振动的粒子）——不掷骰子的上帝。 1999年12月26日，爱因斯坦被美国《时代周刊》评选为“世纪伟人”。

means.word_mean: 1. physicist born in Germany who formulated the special theory of relativity and the general theory of relativity; Einstein also proposed that light consists of discrete quantized bundles of energy (later called photons) (1879-1955)
2. someone who has exceptional intellectual ability and originality;

Sentence.sentence: Einstein used a definition of time for experimental purposes, as that which is measured by a clock.
Albert Einstein predicted this in 1905, when he introduced the concept of relative time as part of his Special Theory of Relativity.
Will there ever be another Einstein?
This is the undercurrent of conversation at Einstein memorial meetings throughout the year
A new Einstein will emerge, scientists say.

sentences.en: Are you surprised to see Einstein on a Chinese stamp?
sentences.cn: 看到中国邮票上的爱因斯坦你感到惊奇吗?

sentences.en: Classical scientific ideas about light were changed by Einstein.
sentences.cn: 爱因斯坦改变了物理学上关于光的传统观念。

sentences.en: During the postwar years in Germany,many honours were heaped upon Einstein.
sentences.cn: 在战后的岁月里,爱因斯坦在德国得到了种种荣誉。

sentences.en: But this didn’t frustrate Einstein.He was content to go as far as he could.
sentences.cn: 但这并没有使爱因斯坦灰心,他对能够更深入地研究而感到满意。
